pronouns-haventHeard.line: Oh, something like, Zeff had fun at AwesomeCon this weekend. Ze got to have coffee with the author of zir favourite webcomic.

pronouns-haventHeard.speaker: zeff
pronouns-haventHeard.line: I dunno. I haven't really spoken these pronouns in person before. I've only read them on the internet. It feels weird to me to say them out loud.

pronouns-haventHeard.speaker: artemis
pronouns-haventHeard.line: Ask if you should try something else, if it's too weird

pronouns-haventHeard.speaker: zeff
pronouns-haventHeard.line: Say you've never told anyone about your pronoun preference before

pronouns-sentence.speaker: artemis
pronouns-sentence.line: Okay... so, like, Zeff is hungry; ze wants to go to zir favourite burger joint?

pronouns-sentence.speaker: zeff
pronouns-sentence.line: Wow, it feels weird to hear someone say those pronouns out loud. I've only read them on the internet.

pronouns-sentence.speaker: artemis
pronouns-sentence.line: Ask if you should try something else, if it's too weird

pronouns-sentence.speaker: zeff
pronouns-sentence.line: Say you've never told anyone about your pronoun preference before

pronouns-weird.speaker: artemis
pronouns-weird.line: Oh? If it's weird, should I try something else?

pronouns-weird.speaker: zeff
pronouns-weird.line: No, I meant... it's weird in a good way. Ze and zir do feel right for me; I'm just not used to what feeling right feels like.

pronouns-weird.speaker: zeff
pronouns-weird.line: It's kind of like I just got a new pair of shoes, and I still need to break them in, but they're way better for my feet than my old ratty shoes were.

pronouns-weird.speaker: artemis
pronouns-weird.line: That makes a lot of sense, actually.

pronouns-weird.speaker: zeff
pronouns-weird.line: Say you've never told anyone about your pronoun preference before

pronouns-neverToldAnyone.speaker: zeff
pronouns-neverToldAnyone.line: Anyway... you're the first person I've ever told my pronoun preference to in person, so thank you for respecting me.

pronouns-neverToldAnyone.speaker: artemis
pronouns-neverToldAnyone.line: Say there's no need to thank you

pronouns-noNeed.speaker: artemis
pronouns-noNeed.line: No need to thank me! Using someone's preferred pronouns should be common human decency, as far as I'm concerned.

pronouns-noNeed.speaker: zeff
pronouns-noNeed.line: You'd think so, but every time I want to tell someone, I feel like they're going to laugh in my face for using made-up words.

pronouns-noNeed.speaker: artemis
pronouns-noNeed.line: That doesn't make sense to me. Aren't all words made up by someone, at some point?

pronouns-noNeed.speaker: artemis
pronouns-noNeed.line: I think it's awesome that people can create new words for concepts for which we've never had the vocabulary.

pronouns-he.speaker: zeff
pronouns-he.line: I... I don't know yet. I'm still trying to figure that out. Male pronouns are okay for now, but, you know, that might change. I might want to be neither.

pronouns-he.speaker: zeff
pronouns-he.line: It's a lot to think about, and I don't think I'm ready for all that just yet.

pronouns-artemis.speaker: zeff
pronouns-artemis.line: While we're on the subject, do you have a pronoun preference other than #artemisSub# and #artemisObj#?

pronouns-artemis.speaker: artemis
pronouns-artemis.line: Say you've been thinking about singular they

pronouns-they.speaker: artemis
pronouns-they.line: I've been thinking about singular they, lately. I have a friend who uses it.

pronouns-they.speaker: zeff
pronouns-they.line: Remark that singular they sounds deliberately vague

pronouns-vague.speaker: zeff
pronouns-vague.line: Yeah, I know of internet people who use singular they, too. But I dunno.

pronouns-vague.speaker: zeff
pronouns-vague.line: Sometimes, people sound like they're talking about more than one person, or being deliberately vague.

pronouns-vague.speaker: artemis
pronouns-vague.line: Be reminded of an amusing story about multiple personalities

pronouns-etymology.speaker: artemis
pronouns-etymology.line: Well, the way they justify it is that the word you used to be plural, but then also became singular after people stopped using thou.

pronouns-etymology.speaker: artemis
pronouns-etymology.line: So it makes sense that the word they can follow a similar trajectory.

pronouns-multiple.speaker: artemis
pronouns-multiple.line: Hah. My friend told a funny story about that, actually.

pronouns-multiple.speaker: artemis
pronouns-multiple.line: They said they went to this event, told people their pronoun preference, and then people got confused because they thought they had multiple personalities.

pronouns-multiple.speaker: artemis
pronouns-multiple.line: Everyone was really nice and polite about it, but then my friend had to awkwardly explain that no, it was singular they.

pronouns-multiple.speaker: zeff
pronouns-multiple.line: Point out that we all contain multitudes

pronouns-multitudes.speaker: zeff
pronouns-multitudes.line: Now that I think about it, don't we all contain multitudes?

pronouns-multitudes.speaker: zeff
pronouns-multitudes.line: I mean, identity isn't this fixed thing. We're different people based on who we're around at a given time.

pronouns-multitudes.speaker: artemis
pronouns-multitudes.line: True. I think this might be why I like they as a pronoun so much. It accounts for the shifting and fluidity within ourselves.

pronouns-stillShe.speaker: artemis
pronouns-stillShe.line: You know, I've thought about that too, and I still prefer she and her.

pronouns-stillShe.speaker: artemis
pronouns-stillShe.line: I mean, I'm not sure I completely or only identify as female, but I feel like she and her can still be broad enough to include someone like me.

pronouns-stillShe.speaker: artemis
pronouns-stillShe.line: Plus, there's so much literature where he and him are used as generic pronouns, and I feel like it's kind of my responsibility as a feminist to counterbalance that. So, yeah.

pronouns-stillShe.speaker: zeff
pronouns-stillShe.line: Yeah, I hate that. It's like how men are default people and women are special people.

pronouns-stillShe.speaker: zeff
pronouns-stillShe.line: Like how Ms. Pac-Man is Pac-Man except with a bow on her head. Or how in ASDF, all the male characters are stick people and all the women are stick people with long hair.

pronouns-stillShe.speaker: zeff
pronouns-stillShe.line: And, of course, those of us who don't fit neatly in the gender binary don't actually exist at all.

pronouns-stillShe.speaker: artemis
pronouns-stillShe.line: Yeah. You'd think that a default person would be gender neutral, but society has this annoying construction of gender neutral as being male.

pronouns-stillShe.speaker: artemis
pronouns-stillShe.line: Which annoys me, but I guess makes sense if you consider that men are the ones running the show and writing about it, and would therefore project their experiences on everyone.

zeffChildhood.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood.line: It's just... I'm so scared, you know? To take that step and openly be who I am.

zeffChildhood.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood.line: Like, when I was a kid, I got teased all the time for being small and kinda girly. So I learned to suppress that part of myself and come across as invisible most of the time.

zeffChildhood.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood.line: Say you're sorry that happened to #zeffObj#

zeffChildhood.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood.line: Talk about how you got into videogames

zeffChildhood-sorry.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-sorry.line: That's so awful. I'm so sorry that happened to you.

zeffChildhood-sorry.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-sorry.line: Talk about how you got into videogames

zeffChildhood-videogames.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-videogames.line: I think that's maybe why I got really into videogames. Whenever I could play as a girl in a game, I would. And no one would know.

zeffChildhood-videogames.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-videogames.line: And if anyone found out I was really a guy, I'd say I just like looking at women, like every dude does.

zeffChildhood-videogames.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-videogames.line: In some ways, it's true. I do like looking at women. But in an aspirational way, in addition to just plain aesthetic preference.

zeffChildhood-videogames.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-videogames.line: Say you preferred to play as big hulking man figures

zeffChildhood-videogames.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-videogames.line: Say you never thought that way about videogames

zeffChildhood-videogames.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-videogames.line: Talk about how you joined the drama club in high school

zeffChildhood-videogames.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-videogames.line: Talk about an openly gay boy you knew in high school

zeffChildhood-hulking.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-hulking.line: That's funny. I never played many games growing up, but my neighbours had Smash Fighters, and when I came over, I'd always pick the biggest hulking manly figure available.

zeffChildhood-hulking.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-hulking.line: I don't know if it helped at all. I always lost at those games.

zeffChildhood-hulking.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-hulking.line: Actually, the smaller, lighter characters tend to give you better control. The big ones deal more damage, but are really clumsy and slow. But anyway.

zeffChildhood-hulking.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-hulking.line: Talk about how you joined the drama club in high school

zeffChildhood-hulking.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-hulking.line: Talk about an openly gay boy you knew in high school

zeffChildhood-neverThought.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-neverThought.line: That... makes a lot of sense. I've never thought about videogames that way before. As a way to be who you can't be in real life.

zeffChildhood-neverThought.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-neverThought.line: Talk about how you joined the drama club in high school

zeffChildhood-neverThought.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-neverThought.line: Talk about an openly gay boy you knew in high school

zeffChildhood-drama.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-drama.line: I joined the drama club in high school, and I found I was actually pretty good at acting.

zeffChildhood-drama.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-drama.line: At least as an actor, I didn't have to worry about living up to any kind of self-image. All I had to do was play the part I was told to play.

zeffChildhood-drama.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-drama.line: Mention that you used to work tech

zeffChildhood-drama.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-drama.line: Suggest you might have done more acting if there were better roles for you

zeffChildhood-tech.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-tech.line: Drama club, huh? I used to be part of the stage crew with all the other freaks and rejects. It was fun.

zeffChildhood-tech.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-tech.line: I wasn't much of an actor, though. Wasn't theatrical or boisterous enough.

zeffChildhood-tech.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-tech.line: But see, that's the thing. I was really shy and quiet most of the time, but when I tried acting, I had a safe space to be someone else for a while.

zeffChildhood-tech.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-tech.line: Instead, I could be someone like a court jester, or a town crier, or a plucky streetwise orphan. Anyone but me, you know?

zeffChildhood-tech.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-tech.line: Wonder what it would be like to be someone completely different for a day

zeffChildhood-tech.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-tech.line: Suggest you might have done more acting if there were better roles for you

zeffChildhood-tech.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-tech.line: Talk about an openly gay boy you knew in high school

zeffChildhood-roles.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-roles.line: I wonder sometimes if I might have done more acting if there were better roles I could have played.

zeffChildhood-roles.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-roles.line: It was all pretty ingenues, matronly mother types, and maybe some other bit parts if we were lucky.

zeffChildhood-roles.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-roles.line: Plus, there was no shortage of girls auditioning for those parts, all of whom were more experienced at acting than me, so I figured I'd just let them have it.

zeffChildhood-roles.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-roles.line: Maybe I was lucky that there weren't as many boys in theatre. Still, I wasn't really offered any of the serious leading man roles; those went to all the handsome buff guys.

zeffChildhood-roles.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-roles.line: And auditioning for one of the women's parts would have gotten me laughed at.

zeffChildhood-roles.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-roles.line: Talk about an openly gay boy you knew in high school

zeffChildhood-jeremy.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-jeremy.line: I remember at my high school, there was this really brave, openly gay guy in my graduating class. His name was Jeremy.

zeffChildhood-jeremy.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-jeremy.line: He didn't care what anyone thought. I always wished I could be like him.

zeffChildhood-jeremy.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-jeremy.line: I also had a huge crush on him, but he was way too popular to notice my existence, let alone look at me in that way.

zeffChildhood-jeremy.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-jeremy.line: Say you had one of those at your high school, too

zeffChildhood-oneOfThose.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-oneOfThose.line: Funny, I think I had one of those at my high school, too. Except his name was Cam, he was always the lead in the school play, and he never noticed me because I worked tech.

zeffChildhood-oneOfThose.description: Bonded over your unattainable high school crushes

zeffChildhood-talentShow.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-talentShow.line: Anyway, there was this one time the school did a talent show thing, and Jeremy decided to lip sync to Britney Spears. While dressed as her. It was epic.

zeffChildhood-talentShow.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-talentShow.line: But then, he came outside to the parking lot to find that someone completely totalled his car and spray painted it with every variation on the word fag in existence.

zeffChildhood-talentShow.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-talentShow.line: No one saw him again after that. We didn't know if he moved or just dropped out or finished high school some other way.

zeffChildhood-talentShow.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-talentShow.line: Ask what would posses anyone to be so hateful

zeffChildhood-talentShow.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-talentShow.line: Ask if #zeffSub# ever got back in touch with Jeremy

zeffChildhood-possess.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-possess.line: That's awful. What would possess anyone to be so hateful?

zeffChildhood-possess.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-possess.line: Hell if I know. But if a guy as popular and well-loved as Jeremy gets that kind of crap, I can't even imagine what would happen to me.

zeffChildhood-possess.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-possess.line: Ask if #zeffSub# ever got back in touch with Jeremy

zeffChildhood-backInTouch.speaker: artemis
zeffChildhood-backInTouch.line: Did you ever get back in touch with Jeremy again?

zeffChildhood-backInTouch.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-backInTouch.line: I'd be lying if I said I didn't try Googling him a few times, but considering that his last name is Smith, he's pretty much impossible to find.

zeffChildhood-backInTouch.speaker: zeff
zeffChildhood-backInTouch.line: And anyway, even if I could find him, he didn't even know who I was, so I doubt anything would come of it.

beingSomeoneElse.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse.line: Sometimes, I wonder what it would be like to be someone completely different, just for a day. Like, say, a straight white man.

beingSomeoneElse.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse.line: What would that entail? Strategic chest binding and whiteface makeup?

beingSomeoneElse.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse.line: I was thinking more along the lines of my consciousness being transferred into a completely different body for 24 hours.

beingSomeoneElse.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse.line: And then seeing how they'd react to me in that body, as opposed to me in my own body.

beingSomeoneElse.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse.line: Ask what #artemisSub# would be hoping to learn from the experiment

beingSomeoneElse.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse.line: Ask if it would be like eighties body-swapping movies

beingSomeoneElse.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse.line: Suggest controlling a volunteer via voice commands and hidden cameras

beingSomeoneElse.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse.line: Wonder what it would be like to be in a cisgender woman's body

beingSomeoneElse-learn.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-learn.line: And what would you be hoping to learn from the experiment?

beingSomeoneElse-learn.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse-learn.line: Well, I'd want to know if straight white guys really do have it easier. I mean, I already know they do, but I want to know how it feels.

beingSomeoneElse-learn.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse-learn.line: I want to know what it's like to have the entire world designed for someone like me to walk through it and use everything in it.

beingSomeoneElse-learn.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse-learn.line: I'm just so... tired of feeling like I don't belong, you know?

beingSomeoneElse-learn.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-learn.line: Wonder what it would be like to be in a cisgender woman's body

beingSomeoneElse-learn.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-learn.line: Say you don't know that the world is designed for anyone

beingSomeoneElse-cisgender.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-cisgender.line: I don't know how much easier I have it than you, honestly. I'm pretty scrawny and kinda girly, as you can plainly see.

beingSomeoneElse-cisgender.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-cisgender.line: I actually kind of want to know what it would be like to be in a cisgender woman's body. Whether people would treat me like a human being instead of like some failure.

beingSomeoneElse-cisgender.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse-cisgender.line: See, here's the thing. All female-bodied people are failures to be human beings by default. At best, they can maybe be sex objects for the male gaze, but never real people.

beingSomeoneElse-cisgender.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-cisgender.line: Well, maybe that would be less disappointing than having people expect all these things out of me because I appear male and then get huffy when I can't live up to those expectations.

beingSomeoneElse-cisgender.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-cisgender.line: I don't know. That's why I want to know.

beingSomeoneElse-designed.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-designed.line: I don't know that the world is designed for anyone.

beingSomeoneElse-designed.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-designed.line: Maybe it fits some people better than others, but I don't think there's really a single person who fits the perfect ideal of a human in this world.

beingSomeoneElse-designed.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-designed.line: I don't live up to the tall, muscular-but-not-too-buff, blonde-haired, square-jawed man ideal I grew up having to live up to. Not that I've never really met anyone who does.

beingSomeoneElse-designed.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse-designed.line: Not even celebrities? Or charismatic world leaders?

beingSomeoneElse-designed.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-designed.line: Sometimes, I think they might be worst off of all.

beingSomeoneElse-designed.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-designed.line: The closer you are to perfect, it's like you're teetering on a ledge, and if anything even nudges you slightly off of perfect, then they all come after you.

beingSomeoneElse-designed.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse-designed.line: Say you'd never want to be put in that position, for sure

beingSomeoneElse-they.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-they.line: Everyone. All of us. We who perpetuate the system even as it oppresses us.

beingSomeoneElse-never.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse-never.line: Yeah, I'd never want to be put in that position, for sure.

beingSomeoneElse-bodySwapping.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-bodySwapping.line: Do you mean like switching bodies, like in those wacky sci-fi movies from the eighties?

beingSomeoneElse-bodySwapping.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse-bodySwapping.line: Maybe. I mean, if the technology existed to body swap temporarily, and it was guaranteed to be safe.

beingSomeoneElse-bodySwapping.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse-bodySwapping.line: And also if there were contracts stipulating that the other person couldn't just run off with your body forever... yeah, I'd be first in line to try that.

beingSomeoneElse-bodySwapping.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-bodySwapping.line: Ask what if you liked someone else's body better

beingSomeoneElse-better.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-better.line: What if you found that you liked someone else's body way more than your own? Wouldn't that just make things worse?

beingSomeoneElse-better.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse-better.line: Possibly? But at the same time, I think I might feel better off for knowing, you know?

beingSomeoneElse-volunteer.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-volunteer.line: Hmm. Maybe you could get a straight white man to volunteer to obey your voice commands and carry a hidden camera around.

beingSomeoneElse-volunteer.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-volunteer.line: That might get you some of the effect you're hoping for.

beingSomeoneElse-volunteer.speaker: artemis
beingSomeoneElse-volunteer.line: You may be on to something, there. But I'd be missing a lot of tactile feedback if that were the case.

beingSomeoneElse-volunteer.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-volunteer.line: Hey, they might just have the technology you're looking for available to mass markets within a couple of years.

beingSomeoneElse-volunteer.speaker: zeff
beingSomeoneElse-volunteer.line: What with so many romantic relationships happening long distance and all, there's definitely demand for remote touchy feely technology.

beingSomeoneElse-switcheroo.speaker: both
beingSomeoneElse-switcheroo.line: (Take off your wig and give it to the other puppet, then put on the other puppet's wig.)

beingSomeoneElse-switcheroo.speaker: both
beingSomeoneElse-switcheroo.line: (Give your mobile device to the other puppet, and take the one that they give you.)

beingSomeoneElse-switcheroo.speaker: both
beingSomeoneElse-switcheroo.line: (Now, switch seats with the other puppet.)

crush.speaker: zeff
crush.line: So, this is kind of embarrassing to admit, but I've had a crush on you for like forever.

crush.speaker: zeff
crush.line: I don't expect you to reciprocate, but I, uh, just wanted to let you know what an awesome person you are.

crush.speaker: artemis
crush.line: Demand to know if Zeff came here to try and hit on you

crush.speaker: artemis
crush.line: Wonder if this is some kind of a joke

crush.speaker: artemis
crush.line: Ask how Zeff can have a crush on you without even knowing you

crush.speaker: artemis
crush.line: Tactfully thank Zeff for the compliment

crush.speaker: artemis
crush.line: Be at a loss for words

crush-whoa.speaker: artemis
crush-whoa.line: Whoa! Did you come here to try to hit on me? Because if that's what this is all about...

crush-whoa.speaker: zeff
crush-whoa.line: Say it's not like that at all, and you're sorry for being an ass

crush-whoa.speaker: zeff
crush-whoa.line: Angrily tell her to forget you ever said anything

crush-ass.speaker: zeff
crush-ass.line: No! No, it's not like that at all! I know you barely even know me, but even so, I know you're totally, utterly out of my league!

crush-ass.speaker: zeff
crush-ass.line: I just figured, maybe there'd be some kind of long shot? I don't know. Oh, geez. I'm such an ass. I'm so sorry. I understand if you don't want to talk to me anymore.

crush-ass.speaker: artemis
crush-ass.line: Say you think that would probably be best, actually

crush-best.speaker: artemis
crush-best.line: I think that would probably be best, actually.

crush-explain.speaker: artemis
crush-explain.line: No, no, it's okay. I just... I don't know.

crush-explain.speaker: artemis
crush-explain.line: Having someone I've only just met suddenly tell me they have a crush on me... well, it's weird. I mean, how would you feel if that happened to you?

crush-explain.speaker: zeff
crush-explain.line: Say you think you'd be flattered and curious

crush-explain.speaker: zeff
crush-explain.line: Angrily tell her to forget you ever said anything

crush-flattered.speaker: zeff
crush-flattered.line: You know, I'm not sure. I'd like to think I'd be flattered, and curious to get to know that person better and stuff.

crush-flattered.speaker: zeff
crush-flattered.line: But, you know, it's not an experience I've been fortunate enough to have happen to me, so I can't really say for certain.

crush-flattered.speaker: zeff
crush-flattered.line: Say that sometimes, you feel like you fall in love with almost everyone you know

crush-forget.speaker: zeff
crush-forget.line: Urgh. Never mind. Forget I said anything.

crush-joke.speaker: artemis
crush-joke.line: You're joking, right? Because I tell you, I'm not the kind of person people have crushes on. Trust me.

crush-joke.speaker: zeff
crush-joke.line: Well, I guess I must not be a person, then, because I'm not joking. I am, in fact, completely serious.

crush-joke.speaker: zeff
crush-joke.line: I think your webcomic is absolutely brilliant, and I think you're absolutely brilliant too. And if that's not attractive, I don't know what is.

crush-joke.speaker: zeff
crush-joke.line: Say that sometimes, you feel like you fall in love with almost everyone you know

crush-know.speaker: artemis
crush-know.line: What? You have a crush on me? But how... but you don't even know me!

crush-know.speaker: zeff
crush-know.line: Maybe that's true. But I know what you're like online.

crush-know.speaker: zeff
crush-know.line: And I think you're smart and funny and super duper talented and, well, that makes me really want to get to know the meatspace you better. If that makes any sense.

crush-know.speaker: zeff
crush-know.line: Say that sometimes, you feel like you fall in love with almost everyone you know

crush-thanks.speaker: artemis
crush-thanks.line: Thanks. That's, uh, very kind of you.

Zeff's theme, dialed back a bit
♫♩࿔♩↕

crush-thanks.speaker: zeff
crush-thanks.line: I mean, don't take it as me trying to hit on you or anything. I know women get hit on a lot at cons, and I really really don't want to be that person.

crush-thanks.speaker: artemis
crush-thanks.line: I, uh, appreciate it. I think...

crush-thanks.speaker: zeff
crush-thanks.line: Say that sometimes, you feel like you fall in love with almost everyone you know

crush-loss.speaker: artemis
crush-loss.line: I... I don't know what to say...

crush-loss.speaker: zeff
crush-loss.line: You don't have to say anything. I just thought you might like to know that there's someone out there who finds you really, really great.

crush-loss.speaker: zeff
crush-loss.line: Because you are. You're smart and talented and hilarious, which I knew when reading your stuff online, but talking to you in person, you're just as cool. If not cooler.

crush-loss.speaker: zeff
crush-loss.line: Say that sometimes, you feel like you fall in love with almost everyone you know

zeffLove.speaker: zeff
zeffLove.line: Sometimes, I feel like I fall in love with almost everyone I know.

zeffLove.speaker: zeff
zeffLove.line: It's been that way ever since I was a kid. Every year in school, I'd have a crush on a new girl. Or boy, sometimes.

zeffLove.speaker: zeff
zeffLove.line: It would be whoever was nicest to me, generally speaking.

zeffLove.speaker: artemis
zeffLove.line: Ask if any of those people ever loved him back

zeffLove.speaker: artemis
zeffLove.line: Say you feel the opposite, personally

zeffLove.speaker: zeff
zeffLove.line: Say you've actually never been in a real relationship before

zeffLove-exhausting.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-exhausting.line: That sounds a bit emotionally exhausting.

zeffLove-exhausting.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-exhausting.line: Maybe it is. I've never been any other way, though, so I wouldn't know.

zeffLove-exhausting.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-exhausting.line: Say you feel the opposite, personally

zeffLove-exhausting.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-exhausting.line: Say you've actually never been in a real relationship before

zeffLove-back.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-back.line: I see. And did any of those people ever love you back?

zeffLove-back.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-back.line: I don't know. Most likely not. I've never exactly been the kind of person most people are looking for in a relationship.

zeffLove-back.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-back.line: Weirdly, it doesn't stop me from falling in love anyway.

zeffLove-back.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-back.line: Say you feel the opposite, personally

zeffLove-back.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-back.line: Say you've actually never been in a real relationship before

zeffLove-opposite.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-opposite.line: I find the opposite, I think. It takes a lot for me to want to be friends with someone, let alone love them.

zeffLove-opposite.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-opposite.line: In fact, it's really weird to me that other people seem to fall in love so easily. Like, where do you get all that love, anyway?

zeffLove-opposite.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-opposite.line: Love isn't a finite resource, you know. And, well, I guess I have this foolish tendency to want to see the best in people.

zeffLove-opposite.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-opposite.line: Maybe it's not very smart of me. But it doesn't make sense to assume everyone's an enemy, either.

zeffLove-opposite.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-opposite.line: I don't assume everyone's the enemy. I just... well, I feel neutral towards most people. I like to assume a blank slate unless and until people prove otherwise.

zeffLove-opposite.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-opposite.line: Say you've actually never been in a real relationship before

zeffLove-relationship.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-relationship.line: The thing is, I've never actually been in a relationship before. A real one, that wasn't totally and utterly one-sided.

zeffLove-relationship.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-relationship.line: And it's weird. I feel like everyone else my age has been in at least one honest to goodness long-term relationship, but somehow, it never happened to me. I don't know why.

zeffLove-relationship.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-relationship.line: Hope out loud that Zeff isn't an entitled Nice Guy

zeffLove-relationship.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-relationship.line: Ask how old Zeff is, anyway

zeffLove-relationship.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-relationship.line: Recall the internet friend you almost had a thing with once

zeffLove-niceGuy.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-niceGuy.line: Urgh. Please, please don't tell me you're one of those Nice Guys who thinks they're entitled to a relationship for no reason other than the fact that they're alive and breathing.

zeffLove-niceGuy.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-niceGuy.line: No! Of course not. I don't think anyone's entitled to a relationship. I just... well, it would be nice to experience what it's like, you know?

zeffLove-niceGuy.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-niceGuy.line: Okay, good. Because, I hear entitled Reddit-reading dudebros whining about that sort of thing a lot, and quite frankly, I'm sick of it.

zeffLove-niceGuy.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-niceGuy.line: Not having experience at long-term relationships is actually more common than people give credit for.

zeffLove-niceGuy.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-niceGuy.line: Mention you haven't had a lot of relationship experience yourself

zeffLove-howOld.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-howOld.line: 23? Pfft. That's not old at all.

zeffLove-howOld.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-howOld.line: In fact, I'm only four years older than you, and I know quite a few people my age who've never been in a long-term relationship before, either.

zeffLove-howOld.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-howOld.line: Mention you haven't had a lot of relationship experience yourself

zeffLove-experience.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-experience.line: And, well, you know, I haven't had a super huge amount of relationship experience, myself.

zeffLove-experience.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-experience.line: I mean, sure, it's less than zero, but it's been awkward and I've said and done a lot of things I regret.

zeffLove-experience.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-experience.line: There are times I actually wish I could hit the reset button and start from a clean slate.

zeffLove-experience.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-experience.line: Sometimes, I wonder if I'd be more optimistic about people if that were the case, instead of the killjoy cynic I am.

zeffLove-experience.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-experience.line: Say you're not sure you could ever be cynical about people

zeffLove-cynical.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-cynical.line: I'm not sure I could ever become cynical about people. I'm not sure I'd even want to be. People are just so interesting to me.

zeffLove-cynical.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-cynical.line: Say that you think you just find people really predictable

zeffLove-devil.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-devil.line: Even really, really terrible people, like serial killers? Or fascist dictators?

zeffLove-devil.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-devil.line: Yes, actually. Well, I wouldn't want to date them, or even be in the same room as them, for that matter, but there's something fascinating about the dark side of human nature.

zeffLove-devil.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-devil.line: Sometimes, I'm amazed at how talented and creative people can be at doing evil things.

zeffLove-devil.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-devil.line: Not that it makes those things less evil in the least. But it also doesn't make them less human.

zeffLove-devil.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-devil.line: Oh, so you're talking admiring from afar. Sure. Anyone can do that. It's all in how you spin it.

zeffLove-devil.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-devil.line: But in a practical sense, why bother thinking that way, or even caring? They'd probably just kill you.

zeffLove-devil.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-devil.line: I don't know. To me, understanding humanity means understanding the whole picture.

zeffLove-devil.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-devil.line: Thinking that people who commit atrocities are somehow less human, well, that contributes to the harmful us-against-them thinking that allows atrocities to happen in the first place.

zeffLove-devil.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-devil.line: Are we even talking about the same thing we were talking about before?

zeffLove-devil.speaker: zeff
zeffLove-devil.line: Probably not. But in my defence, you brought up this particular tangent.

zeffLove-predictable.speaker: artemis
zeffLove-predictable.line: Really? Because after a while, I find that they get really predictable. For once, I'd like to meet someone who truly surprised me.

crumpet.speaker: zeff
crumpet.line: Actually, there was almost this one time...

crumpet.speaker: zeff
crumpet.line: There was a girl I met on this fan discussion forum for this videogame I was really into at the time, Symphony of the Elements.

crumpet.speaker: artemis
crumpet.line: Ask what Symphony of the Elements is about

crumpet.speaker: artemis
crumpet.line: Be impressed that #zeffSub# managed to find a girl on an videogame forum

crumpet-elements.speaker: artemis
crumpet-elements.line: I've never heard of Symphony of the Elements. What's it about?

crumpet-elements.speaker: zeff
crumpet-elements.line: It's a massively multiplayer online roleplaying game set in a medieval fantasy world where everything is controlled by music.

crumpet-elements.speaker: zeff
crumpet-elements.line: You get together and form bands with people and battle with other bands.

crumpet-elements.speaker: artemis
crumpet-elements.line: Say that sounds really cool and creative

crumpet-elements.speaker: zeff
crumpet-elements.line: Mention Symphony of the Elements's eventual demise

crumpet-cool.speaker: artemis
crumpet-cool.line: That sounds really cool and creative.

crumpet-cool.speaker: zeff
crumpet-cool.line: Mention Symphony of the Elements's eventual demise

crumpet-interesting.speaker: zeff
crumpet-interesting.line: Mention Symphony of the Elements's eventual demise

crumpet-demise.speaker: zeff
crumpet-demise.line: Of course, as with any MMORPG that isn't Epic Fantasy Online, it didn't gain enough players and, after a year, was canned.

crumpet-demise.speaker: zeff
crumpet-demise.line: The fan community was really tight, though.

crumpet-internet.speaker: artemis
crumpet-internet.line: You managed to find the one girl who hangs out on an internet forum about a videogame. That's impressive.

crumpet-internet.speaker: zeff
crumpet-internet.line: There were lots of women who were into that game, actually. A de-emphasis on violence and a strong emphasis on teamwork will do that.

crumpet-internet.speaker: artemis
crumpet-internet.line: Ask if it's essentialist to assume women don't like violence

crumpet-essentialist.speaker: artemis
crumpet-essentialist.line: Wait... isn't it kind of essentialist to assume women don't like violence?

crumpet-essentialist.speaker: zeff
crumpet-essentialist.line: Say it's more that dudebros don't like not having violence

crumpet-essentialist.speaker: zeff
crumpet-essentialist.line: Ask if it's essentialist to assume women don't play videogames

crumpet-dudebros.speaker: zeff
crumpet-dudebros.line: Well, what I meant was that the typical dudebro online gamer crowd isn't as likely to play something non-violent.

crumpet-dudebros.speaker: zeff
crumpet-dudebros.line: Without them around to shout misogynist, homophobic slurs and teabag people and the like, more women felt safe enough to be part of the community.

crumpet-touche.speaker: zeff
crumpet-touche.line: Isn't it essentialist to assume women don't go on internet forums about videogames?

crumpet-more.speaker: zeff
crumpet-more.line: Anyway. This girl -- she went by the name Crumpet.

crumpet-more.speaker: zeff
crumpet-more.line: It was an in-joke from the game, where this character makes a bad translation foible when trying to be flirtatious, and winds up telling his love interest that she has beautiful crumpets.

crumpet-more.speaker: zeff
crumpet-more.line: Talk about Crumpet's impressive sense of humour

crumpet-more.speaker: zeff
crumpet-more.line: Talk about how you became friends

crumpet-lol.speaker: zeff
crumpet-lol.line: Talk about Crumpet's impressive sense of humour

crumpet-lol.speaker: zeff
crumpet-lol.line: Talk about how you became friends

crumpet-humour.speaker: zeff
crumpet-humour.line: The things she would write on the forums were always really, really funny. Like, I could barely even keep up with her, and neither could anyone else.

crumpet-humour.speaker: zeff
crumpet-humour.line: She'd make these animated gifs out of screencaps of the game that had all these hilarious jokes in them, and I'd barely be able to contain myself when I saw them posted.

crumpet-humour.speaker: artemis
crumpet-humour.line: Say she sounds like someone you'd like to be friends with

crumpet-humour.speaker: zeff
crumpet-humour.line: Talk about how you became friends

crumpet-friends.speaker: artemis
crumpet-friends.line: Sounds like someone I'd like to be friends with.

crumpet-friends.speaker: zeff
crumpet-friends.line: Talk about how you became friends

crumpet-hangOut.speaker: zeff
crumpet-hangOut.line: So, anyway, somehow, through some miracle I can't even fathom, we became friends and started emailing and IMing each other.

crumpet-hangOut.speaker: zeff
crumpet-hangOut.line: It then transpired that she happened to live just 2 hours from me, and the subject of hanging out in person was brought up.

crumpet-hangOut.speaker: zeff
crumpet-hangOut.line: We set up a hangout date, and I drove over to see her.

crumpet-hangOut.speaker: zeff
crumpet-hangOut.line: We went to an art museum, and then to this wood-fired oven pizza place for lunch, and then for a long walk in the park, talking all the while.

crumpet-hangOut.speaker: zeff
crumpet-hangOut.line: She was just as hilarious and witty as she was online, and I couldn't remember having so much fun talking to another person for the longest time.

crumpet-hangOut.speaker: artemis
crumpet-hangOut.line: Mention your fondness for art gallery dates

crumpet-hangOut.speaker: artemis
crumpet-hangOut.line: Mention your fondness for wood-fired oven pizza

crumpet-hangOut.speaker: artemis
crumpet-hangOut.line: Mention your fondness for long walks in the park

crumpet-hangOut.speaker: zeff
crumpet-hangOut.line: Talk about how you got scared

crumpet-gallery.speaker: artemis
crumpet-gallery.line: Hah. I love art gallery dates. They are almost always awesome.

crumpet-gallery.speaker: artemis
crumpet-gallery.line: Wait, there was one exception. I went on an art gallery date once with a guy who wouldn't even talk the whole time. That was not nearly as much fun.

crumpet-gallery.speaker: zeff
crumpet-gallery.line: Talk about how you got scared

crumpet-pizza.speaker: artemis
crumpet-pizza.line: Mmm... wood-fired oven pizza. There's a great place for such near my apartment. It's expensive, though.

crumpet-pizza.speaker: zeff
crumpet-pizza.line: Talk about how you got scared

crumpet-walks.speaker: artemis
crumpet-walks.line: I love long walks in the park! Usually, I prefer going on them by myself, though.

crumpet-walks.speaker: zeff
crumpet-walks.line: Talk about how you got scared

crumpet-scared.speaker: zeff
crumpet-scared.line: But then... I got scared. I started to feel like I was boring to her. I started to worry that she'd find out what a loser I am, and then hate me.

crumpet-scared.speaker: zeff
crumpet-scared.line: When I went home, she'd try and talk to me some more, and set up another day to hang out, but I'd always make some excuse and claim I was busy.

crumpet-scared.speaker: artemis
crumpet-scared.line: Say that was an asshole move

crumpet-asshole.speaker: artemis
crumpet-asshole.line: I mean, she obviously liked you and didn't think you were a loser, otherwise why would she even want to hang out with you again in the first place?

crumpet-asshole.speaker: zeff
crumpet-asshole.line: I know, I know. It was awful of me. But I was really scared and vulnerable.

crumpet-sympathetic.speaker: artemis
crumpet-sympathetic.line: I think I'd be super intimidated too.

crumpet-lament.speaker: zeff
crumpet-lament.line: So, yeah. Eventually, I stopped hanging out on those forums, she stopped talking to me, and we went on with our lives. So it goes.

crumpet-lament.speaker: zeff
crumpet-lament.line: I always do wonder what would have happened if I hadn't been such a coward. Would she have been my first everything?

crumpet-lament.speaker: zeff
crumpet-lament.line: Or would she have rejected me eventually? I guess I'll never know.

crumpet-lament.speaker: artemis
crumpet-lament.line: Ask if maybe #zeffSub# could get back in touch with her

crumpet-back.speaker: artemis
crumpet-back.line: Could you maybe try getting back in touch with her? Explaining how you felt, saying you're sorry?

crumpet-back.speaker: zeff
crumpet-back.line: I don't know how that would go over. I don't think it would be the same, anyway.

crumpet-back.speaker: zeff
crumpet-back.line: She's likely moved on; I've definitely moved on. So it goes.

crumpet-back.speaker: artemis
crumpet-back.line: You might be surprised. She could be a person who easily forgives this sort of thing.

crumpet-back.speaker: artemis
crumpet-back.line: Or who's been waiting to hear a long-overdue and much-deserved apology for ages.

crumpet-back.speaker: zeff
crumpet-back.line: Accept that maybe Artemis is right

crumpet-back.speaker: zeff
crumpet-back.line: Say you'd rather not revisit the past

crumpet-right.speaker: zeff
crumpet-right.line: You know, maybe you're right. Maybe I should try and look her up and see what she's up to these days.

crumpet-revisit.speaker: zeff
crumpet-revisit.line: Nah. I'd rather not revisit the past, especially when the past is so embarrassing.

crumpet-revisit.speaker: zeff
crumpet-revisit.line: All I can really do now is avoid screwing up in the future. That's how I'm feeling right now, anyway.

artemisLove.speaker: zeff
artemisLove.line: What were your past relationships like? Out of curiosity.

artemisLove.speaker: artemis
artemisLove.line: Talk about your high school sweetheart

artemisLove.speaker: artemis
artemisLove.line: Say you'd rather not talk about them

artemisLove-leslie.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-leslie.line: I fell for my best friend in high school. Well, actually, she fell for me first.

artemisLove-leslie.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-leslie.line: Leslie was a year younger than me, but we both worked tech the year the drama club did a production of Nothing's Fair in Art, Love, or War.

artemisLove-leslie.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-leslie.line: A bunch of us on the stage crew became a tight group of social outcast friends.

artemisLove-leslie.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-leslie.line: Mention a fondness for the arts as a safe haven for social rejects

artemisLove-arts.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-arts.line: Ah, the arts. A safe haven for social rejects everywhere.

artemisLove-arts.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-arts.line: I mean that in the best way possible, of course.

artemisLove-im.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-im.line: Anyway, after hanging out a bunch as a group, Leslie and I got to talking online on IM.

artemisLove-im.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-im.line: I still have such wonderful memories of tapping away on a chunky keyboard bathed in a bluish hue from a 17-inch CRT screen while trying not to wake my parents.

artemisLove-im.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-im.line: We'd talk about everything. Life, love, sex, identity, good books, philosophy, hair dye, you name it.

artemisLove-im.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-im.line: Be reminded of chatting with your guildmates late into the night

artemisLove-im.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-im.line: Talk about how you kept your relationship with Leslie a secret

artemisLove-guildmates.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-guildmates.line: That takes me back to when I used to chat on IM with my Epic Fantasy Online guildmates back in high school and neglect all my homework. Good times.

artemisLove-guildmates.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-guildmates.line: Talk about how you kept your relationship with Leslie a secret

artemisLove-secret.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-secret.line: When we started dating, we didn't tell anyone. Both our parents were pretty conservative and wouldn't have understood.

artemisLove-secret.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-secret.line: As for our friends... well, we didn't want to be the subject of rumours and gossip.

artemisLove-secret.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-secret.line: In retrospect, we were probably gossiped about anyway, but at the time, we thought we were being mature.

artemisLove-secret.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-secret.line: Let me guess: it didn't end well?

artemisLove-secret.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-secret.line: We inevitably broke up because, well, keeping secrets is hard. She dumped me. Said she wasn't ready for a relationship right now. I was devastated.

artemisLove-secret.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-secret.line: A bit later, I started dating a boy with pretty hair; I was lonely and he was there and willing.

artemisLove-secret.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-secret.line: Leslie felt like I betrayed her. I argued that she was the one who dumped me.

artemisLove-secret.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-secret.line: Things got awkward and rough between us pretty fast, as you can imagine.

artemisLove-secret.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-secret.line: Say you hope things got better

artemisLove-secret.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-secret.line: Talk about where things are now

artemisLove-better.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-better.line: That's sad. I hope things got better.

artemisLove-better.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-better.line: Talk about where things are now

artemisLove-cordial.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-cordial.line: Years after we'd both graduated, we ran into each other again and were cordial with one another. Even friendly. But never quite as close again.

artemisLove-cordial.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-cordial.line: She's apparently now dating an Welsh girl five years younger who's getting a PhD in English literature. They seem happy. I guess that's really all I can ask for.

artemisLove-cordial.description: Told the sordid tale of a past lover

artemisLove-ed.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-ed.line: I met this guy online a few years back. Another cartoonist, about 15 years older than me, who read my comic and liked it.

artemisLove-ed.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-ed.line: Ed actually went to school to study animation back in the dinosaur ages, but flunked out due to undiagnosed bipolar disorder. His work was really good, but mostly unfinished.

artemisLove-ed.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-ed.line: He knew how to do just about anything: draw, write, make prog rock-inspired music... kind of a modern-day Renaissance man.

artemisLove-ed.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-ed.line: I feel like if he'd actually finished any of the work he'd started, he'd be a famous household name by now.

artemisLove-ed.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-ed.line: Say you aren't really into prog rock

artemisLove-ed.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-ed.line: Talk about how you became close

artemisLove-prog.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-prog.line: I never really got into prog rock. Always felt like too much of a boy's club to me.

artemisLove-prog.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-prog.line: Yeah, I'm not a big fan of the whole scene myself, but I like the stuff it does with time signatures sometimes.

artemisLove-prog.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-prog.line: Talk about how you became close

artemisLove-close.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-close.line: Anyway, as the story goes, we became close, and for the longest time, I felt like he was the only person in the world who really understood me. As an artist and as a friend, really.

artemisLove-close.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-close.line: He was this wonderful, accepting guy, unfazed by anything I threw at him. I'd never really met anyone like that before.

artemisLove-wrong.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-wrong.line: Sounds like a really great guy.

artemisLove-wrong.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-wrong.line: Why are you talking about him in the past tense, though? Something go wrong?

artemisLove-complicating.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-complicating.line: The complicating factor, other than him living on the other side of the country, was that he was married to this woman he loved very much.

artemisLove-complicating.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-complicating.line: I kept thinking, okay, that's fine, we'll just be friends.

artemisLove-complicating.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-complicating.line: But then, it transpired that he was polyamorous, and also loved me. His wife, sadly, wasn't. And then she got suspicious.

artemisLove-complicating.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-complicating.line: There were some really big arguments, apparently. She almost left him. But they're still together.

artemisLove-complicating.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-complicating.line: And I'm still friends with him, though we don't talk as much as we used to anymore.

artemisLove-complicating.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-complicating.line: Say you're glad you got to know him, in spite of everything

artemisLove-complicating.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-complicating.line: Ask if Artemis identifies as polyamorous

artemisLove-awkward.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-awkward.line: Oh. Well, that would be awkward, wouldn't it?

artemisLove-awkward.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-awkward.line: Say you're glad you got to know him, in spite of everything

artemisLove-glad.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-glad.line: I know the whole age difference thing sounds weird and creepy, and the whole being married bit, but it honestly never felt that way to me.

artemisLove-glad.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-glad.line: I'm just... I'm really glad I got to know him and that we came into each other's lives. He made me realise a lot of stuff about myself and my art that I didn't know was possible.

artemisLove-glad.description: Told the sordid tale of a past lover

artemisLove-glad.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-glad.line: Ask if Artemis identifies as polyamorous

artemisLove-poly.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-poly.line: Would you, uh, consider yourself polyamorous?

artemisLove-poly.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-poly.line: You know, I've thought about it, and I'm not entirely sure.

artemisLove-poly.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-poly.line: I'm open to the idea of loving more than one person at a time. I mean, most people can do it in series, so why not in parallel?

artemisLove-poly.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-poly.line: But in practice, I know it can be hard and complicated. And I don't know how I'd deal with it. I don't have the experience.

artemisLove-poly.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-poly.line: Usually, I'm lucky to have one person love me at a time; mostly, I spend my life comfortably alone.

artemisLove-poly.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-poly.line: Say forced monogamy seems unrealistic to you now

artemisLove-agree.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-agree.line: That's kinda what I'm thinking, too. It sounds like a nice idea, but in practice, it seems like a lot more potential for things to go wrong.

artemisLove-agree.speaker: zeff
artemisLove-agree.line: It's like the possible complications increase exponentially when you introduce new people.

artemisLove-agree.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-agree.line: Say forced monogamy seems unrealistic to you now

artemisLove-monogamy.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-monogamy.line: All I really know is, promising oneself to monogamy doesn't sound realistic anymore, after all that happened with Ed.

artemisLove-monogamy.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-monogamy.line: What happens if you do fall in love with someone else? Doesn't mean there's anything wrong with the person you were with before, and that you should necessarily ditch them.

artemisLove-monogamy.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-monogamy.line: If it so happens that you only fall for one person at a time, that's fine, but you can't force that outcome.

artemisLove-monogamy.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-monogamy.line: Trying to suppress these things always ends badly for everyone involved. You just can't control human emotion like that. It's so complicated.

artemisLove-ratherNot.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-ratherNot.line: I'd... rather not talk about them. At least, not to someone I've just met.

artemisLove-ratherNot.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-ratherNot.line: There's nothing really to know, except that love isn't the magical thing it's all hyped up to be.

artemisLove-ratherNot.speaker: artemis
artemisLove-ratherNot.line: Of course, nothing I could ever say could convince someone who hasn't experienced it before themself, so... let's just leave it at that.

artemisLeaves.speaker: artemis
artemisLeaves.line: Make some kind of an excuse

artemisLeaves-excuse.speaker: artemis
artemisLeaves-excuse.line: I, uh, promised some folks I'd meet up with them, so, uh. Yeah.

artemisLeaves-niceMeeting.speaker: zeff
artemisLeaves-niceMeeting.line: It was nice to finally meet you! Maybe I'll see you again on the internet?

zeffLeaves.speaker: zeff
zeffLeaves.line: Well, uh, I guess I'd better get going.

zeffLeaves.speaker: artemis
zeffLeaves.line: Tell Zeff it was nice to meet #zeffObj#

zeffLeaves-niceToMeet.speaker: artemis
zeffLeaves-niceToMeet.line: Okay. It was nice to meet you, Zeff.

pleasantSurprise.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise.line: You know, I didn't expect to have this much fun talking to someone I've never met before.

pleasantSurprise.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise.line: Philosophically point out that it's easier to talk to strangers

pleasantSurprise.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise.line: Say you knew Artemis would be fun to talk to because you've read #artemisDet# stuff online

pleasantSurprise-philosophical.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-philosophical.line: When you don't already have a pre-existing relationship with a person, it's way easier to just say what's on your mind. There's less at stake that way.

pleasantSurprise-philosophical.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-philosophical.line: I've never thought about it like that before.

pleasantSurprise-philosophical.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-philosophical.line: Usually, I'm more comfortable talking people I do know, because that means I know enough about them to trust them. So I avoid random conversations with strangers.

pleasantSurprise-philosophical.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-philosophical.line: Ask what made #artemisObj# not avoid this one

pleasantSurprise-philosophical.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-philosophical.line: Say you knew Artemis would be fun to talk to because you've read #artemisDet# stuff online

pleasantSurprise-avoid.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-avoid.line: And what made you not avoid this one?

pleasantSurprise-avoid.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-avoid.line: Say you feel more comfortable around #zeffObj# than you do around most strangers

pleasantSurprise-avoid.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-avoid.line: Say you're in a bit of a weird headspace with AwesomeCon going on around you

pleasantSurprise-comfortable.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-comfortable.line: I don't know. I guess I feel more comfortable around you than I do around most strangers.

pleasantSurprise-comfortable.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-comfortable.line: Maybe it's because you already know who I am from the internet. And, well, you're the one who decided to approach me, and not many people do that.

pleasantSurprise-comfortable.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-comfortable.line: Well, thanks. It's nice to know I'm not a complete weirdo to run away from really really fast.

pleasantSurprise-comfortable.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-comfortable.line: Ask if Zeff usually gets that kind of a reaction

pleasantSurprise-usually.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-usually.line: Why? Do you usually get that kind of a reaction?

pleasantSurprise-usually.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-usually.line: Say you don't, but you hear so many stories about creeps

pleasantSurprise-creeps.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-creeps.line: No, but I hear stories all the time about women being approached by strange men and getting creeped out, and I so don't want to be that guy.

pleasantSurprise-creeps.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-creeps.line: It's true. But the difference with you is, you're actually treating me like a real person with thoughts and opinions.

pleasantSurprise-creeps.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-creeps.line: And not once have I caught you staring at my chest.

pleasantSurprise-creeps.line: Turn that statement into a slightly more flirtatious direction

pleasantSurprise-creeps.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-creeps.line: Say you'd be uncomfortable too if someone stared at your crotch

pleasantSurprise-flirty.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-flirty.line: Oh good! I've been just subtle enough.

pleasantSurprise-crotch.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-crotch.line: Well, I believe in treating people as I would want them to treat me.

pleasantSurprise-crotch.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-crotch.line: It would be mighty uncomfortable if someone talked to me and stared at my crotch the whole time.

pleasantSurprise-werewolf.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-werewolf.line: Sometimes. But only when there's a full moon and I start changing into my evil green werewolf form. That usually gets people plenty alarmed.

pleasantSurprise-what.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-what.line: Explain that you were trying to make a joke

pleasantSurprise-joke.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-joke.line: I was joking. I'm not really a werewolf.

pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.line: I'm not sure. I'm kind of in a weird headspace right now, with AwesomeCon going on around me.

pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.line: It's kind of an altered reality where the pseudonymity of the internet blends with real life to create this environment that's... more open, I guess?

pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.line: Yeah. Sometimes, I wish I could live somewhere where AwesomeCon-like things could happen all year round.

pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.line: But sometimes, I wonder if that would just become the new normal, and maybe what makes AwesomeCon and other conventions so special is that they only happen once a year.

pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.line: Good point. I definitely wouldn't want to be at AwesomeCon all year round. It would get overwhelming pretty quickly.

pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-awesomeCon.line: But surprisingly, I guess I have some nice things to say about it as a once-a-year experience, especially if it means having good conversations with interesting people.

pleasantSurprise-knew.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-knew.line: Well, the thing is, I knew you'd be fun to talk to because I've read your stuff online.

pleasantSurprise-knew.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-knew.line: You're a really awesome, interesting person, Artemis.

pleasantSurprise-wow.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-wow.line: Wow. Thanks. You're pretty interesting yourself.

pleasantSurprise-wow.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-wow.line: Honestly, I'm sorry I didn't interact with you online much until now.

pleasantSurprise-wow.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-wow.line: Ask if Artemis might give people of the benefit of the doubt more often

pleasantSurprise-wow.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-wow.line: Say you don't have as much interesting stuff to say online as Artemis does

pleasantSurprise-benefit.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-benefit.line: Do you think this means you'll give people on the internet the benefit of the doubt more often?

pleasantSurprise-benefit.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-benefit.line: I don't know. It's hard to say. There are probably lots of people I'd have good conversations with if I gave them the chance.

pleasantSurprise-benefit.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-benefit.line: But it's hard to say how well that translates to the online world and whether I'd like to read what they're saying. People are weird.

pleasantSurprise-interesting.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-interesting.line: It's all right. I don't have as much interesting stuff to say online as you do.

pleasantSurprise-interesting.speaker: zeff
pleasantSurprise-interesting.line: My tweets don't become widely retweeted and I don't ever write viral blog posts, or make music that's heavily shared, or anything like that.

pleasantSurprise-encourage.speaker: artemis
pleasantSurprise-encourage.line: Well, maybe you should write and tweet and such more often. You do have interesting things to say. Just give it time and practice.

gettingFood-unPetit.line: Well, there's this cute and surprisingly inexpensive little French place two blocks away that's adjacent to a cheese shop.

gettingFood-unPetit.speaker: artemis
gettingFood-unPetit.line: I think it's called Un Petit d'Un Petit or something.

gettingFood-unPetit.speaker: zeff
gettingFood-unPetit.line: Ask if Artemis would like to go there with you

gettingFood-comeWith.speaker: zeff
gettingFood-comeWith.line: I mean, if you'd rather be alone, that's fine, but I'd love the company if you're up for it.

gettingFood-yes.speaker: artemis

gettingFood-yes.speaker: artemis
gettingFood-yes.line: Besides, you'd probably get lost if I weren't there. There's this alleyway you have to go through that most people miss if they don't know where it is.

gettingFood-plans.speaker: artemis
gettingFood-plans.line: You know, I would, but I already made plans to get pizza with a bunch of webcomic artists.

gettingFood-plans.speaker: zeff
gettingFood-plans.line: Oh. Okay. I'll try out that place on my own, then.

gettingFood-plans.speaker: zeff
gettingFood-plans.line: It was great to meet you! Hope the rest of your AwesomeCon experience goes well.

gettingFood-pizza.speaker: artemis
gettingFood-pizza.line: Their pizza is kinda greasy, but it really hits the spot when basically all you've consumed today is coffee and bad convention centre food.

gettingFood-invite.speaker: artemis
gettingFood-invite.line: If you want to come with me, you're more than welcome to.

gettingFood-nah.speaker: zeff
gettingFood-nah.line: I'd like to, but I feel like I'd be kinda out of place. I mean, I'm not a webcomic artist myself...

gettingFood-nah.speaker: zeff
gettingFood-nah.line: I guess I'll go to the food court again or something. I'll figure it out.

gettingFood-nah.speaker: artemis
gettingFood-nah.line: Okay. Well, it was nice to meet you, Zeff.

gettingFood-dontInvite.speaker: artemis
gettingFood-dontInvite.line: Sadly, I think it's more of an invite-only thing. So, I'd recommend hitting up the food court in the mall.

gettingFood-dontInvite.speaker: zeff
gettingFood-dontInvite.line: Oh. Okay. Well... it was nice meeting you.

disappointed-exactly.speaker: artemis
disappointed-exactly.line: Oh? And who exactly was it you were expecting me to be?

disappointed-exactly.speaker: zeff
disappointed-exactly.line: I dunno... I just figured, from your Twitter feed, it seemed to me like we had a lot in common.

disappointed-exactly.speaker: zeff
disappointed-exactly.line: You seemed like someone I might want to be friends with for real, you know?

disappointed-exactly.speaker: artemis
disappointed-exactly.line: Explain that you can't know a person from online interaction alone

disappointed-online.speaker: artemis
disappointed-online.line: Well, you can't expect to really know everything about a person just from what they write online.

disappointed-online.speaker: artemis
disappointed-online.line: What really happens is that you build up this idealised image of someone in your head based on fragments of text. The problem is, that person isn't real.

disappointed-online.speaker: artemis
disappointed-online.line: Meanwhile, there's an actual person at the other end of all that text who has their own thoughts and feelings, who has very little to do with the image in your head.

disappointed-online.speaker: artemis
disappointed-online.line: So, yeah. I can see why that would be disappointing. I don't know how to make it better, though, so don't even ask.

disappointed-gently.speaker: artemis
disappointed-gently.line: Well, I'm sorry if I disappointed you. You seem like a perfectly okay person. I just...

disappointed-gently.speaker: artemis
disappointed-gently.line: Look, not everyone's meant to be friends with everyone. Sometimes, the chemistry or whatever just isn't there.

artemisPissed.line: Yell at #zeffObj# for acting entitled to your friendship

artemisPissed-entitled.line: There's a word for this kind of behaviour. It's called creepy.

artemisPissed-entitled.speaker: zeff
artemisPissed-entitled.line: Retort that at least you don't hate everyone
