pee-hum.line: Get bored and leave the coffee shop

pee-leave.speaker: artemis
pee-leave.line: (Walk back onstage, noticing that Zeff is gone.)

pee-leave.speaker: artemis
pee-leave.line: (Sit back down, relieved, and go back to sipping your coffee and staring at your smartphone.)

pee-back.speaker: artemis
pee-back.line: Sorry about that. What were we talking about, again?

gloomBorg.speaker: zeff
gloomBorg.line: Whoa, that's the best GloomBorg costume I've ever seen!

gloomBorg.speaker: artemis
gloomBorg.line: Admit to being unfamiliar with GloomBorg

gloomBorg-unfamiliar.speaker: artemis
gloomBorg-unfamiliar.line: I'm afraid I'm not familiar with where that's from.

gloomBorg-unfamiliar.speaker: zeff
gloomBorg-unfamiliar.line: Well, it's this mid-90s anime and manga series that's based on Albert Camus's The Stranger, except with cyborgs.

gloomBorg-unfamiliar.speaker: artemis
gloomBorg-unfamiliar.line: Express surprise that Japanese cartoons would involve such subject matter

gloomBorg-japanese.speaker: artemis
gloomBorg-japanese.line: Interesting. I didn't know French existentialism was ever a subject of fascination in Japanese cartoons.

gloomBorg-japanese.speaker: zeff
gloomBorg-japanese.line: Well, you'd be surprised at how well-recognised an art form it is over there. It's a shame the same isn't true here.

gloomBorg-japanese.speaker: artemis
gloomBorg-japanese.line: That, I agree with. People sometimes ask me why I draw comics when I could be writing novels instead, as if there's something inherently superior about the latter. I find it vexing.

marchingBand.speaker: zeff
marchingBand.line: Ah, marching band. I used to play the clarinet back in high school. Those were good times.

marchingBand.speaker: artemis
marchingBand.line: Say you used to play French horn

marchingBand.speaker: zeff
marchingBand.line: Say that band was the only part of high school you enjoyed

marchingBand-meToo.speaker: artemis
marchingBand-meToo.line: I played French horn. Only for a couple of years, though. I was never really much of a band nerd. Music wasn't my strong suit.

marchingBand-meToo.speaker: zeff
marchingBand-meToo.line: Say that band was the only part of high school you enjoyed

marchingBand-enjoyed.speaker: zeff
marchingBand-enjoyed.line: Band was the only part of high school I really enjoyed, aside from theatre. The people weren't assholes, relatively speaking.

marchingBand-enjoyed.speaker: zeff
marchingBand-enjoyed.line: And we even got to go to Hawaii one year.

marchingBand-enjoyed.speaker: zeff
marchingBand-enjoyed.line: Yeah. There was a music festival going on that our band director got us into. But we did lots of sightseeing, too.

marchingBand-enjoyed.speaker: zeff
marchingBand-enjoyed.line: Although most of what I remember involves me and a couple of tuba players getting lost in the USS Arizona war memorial and missing our tour bus.

marchingBand-enjoyed.speaker: zeff
marchingBand-enjoyed.line: Oh, and that the tour bus was being driven by this guy named Cousin Randy, who kept making bad jokes about international bathrooms.

marchingBand-enjoyed.speaker: artemis
marchingBand-enjoyed.line: Ask if it's the international bathroom joke you know

marchingBand-bathroom.speaker: artemis
marchingBand-bathroom.line: You mean like, first you're Russian, then European, and when you come out, you're Finnish?

marriage.speaker: artemis
marriage.line: Eeeugh. For once, I'd like to see someone say no to a public marriage proposal. That would make my day.

marriage.speaker: zeff
marriage.line: Say you think the marriage proposal was sweet

marriage.speaker: zeff
marriage.line: Insinuate that #artemisSub# must not be into romance

marriage-sweet.speaker: zeff
marriage-sweet.line: Aw, can't you just be happy for them? I think it's sweet when people express their love for one another out in public.

marriage-sweet.speaker: artemis
marriage-sweet.line: I for one would really hate being put on the spot like that. Marriage is a pretty huge deal; it's a contract, for fuck's sake.

marriage-sweet.speaker: artemis
marriage-sweet.line: Do people normally surprise each other with contracts? No, they negotiate them like rational adults.

marriage-sweet.speaker: zeff
marriage-sweet.line: Insinuate that #artemisSub# must not be into romance

marriage-sweet.speaker: zeff
marriage-sweet.line: Ask how Artemis knows they didn't negotiate beforehand

marriage-romance.speaker: zeff
marriage-romance.line: Wow, you're really not into romance, are you?

marriage-romance.speaker: artemis
marriage-romance.line: Say that depends on one's definition of romance

marriage-definition.speaker: artemis
marriage-definition.line: No, my definition of romance is way more interesting and complicated than cliches and the wedding industrial complex.

marriage-definition.speaker: zeff
marriage-definition.line: Well, how do you define romance, then?

marriage-definition.speaker: artemis
marriage-definition.line: I guess for me, it's things that make you deliriously happy to be alive. It doesn't necessarily have to involve another person.

marriage-definition.speaker: artemis
marriage-definition.line: I've felt romance walking alone at night on a tree-lined street covered in autumn leaves.

marriage-definition.speaker: artemis
marriage-definition.line: And when another person is involved, it's just a sense of awe in how great that person is.

marriage-definition.speaker: artemis
marriage-definition.line: You don't feel the need to demand anything from them, because their very existence makes the world a better place in which to be.

marriage-nope.speaker: artemis
marriage-nope.line: If romance is all about cheesy public displays and putting people on the spot to say yes to you right then and there, then no, I'm really not into romance at all.

marriage-negotiate.speaker: zeff
marriage-negotiate.line: And how do you know they didn't negotiate beforehand? Could be that being surprised is exactly what she wants.

marriage-negotiate.speaker: artemis
marriage-negotiate.line: Doesn't that kind of defeat the point of a surprise?

marriage-negotiate.speaker: zeff
marriage-negotiate.line: Well, it could be that he knows she wants to get hitched, but she doesn't know when and how he'll pop the question.

marriage-negotiate.speaker: zeff
marriage-negotiate.line: It's not the are we getting married part that's necessarily exciting, but the what's he going to do to show his love for me part is something to look forward to.

utilityKilt.speaker: artemis
utilityKilt.line: I hope it's not too inappropriate to say this, but man, does that guy in the utility kilt have beautiful legs or what?

utilityKilt.speaker: zeff
utilityKilt.line: You know what? I'm going to have to agree with you on that. Those legs sure are bodacious. I mean, check out those knobbly knees.

utilityKilt.speaker: artemis
utilityKilt.line: Whoa, I think that woman over there is glaring at us.

utilityKilt.speaker: zeff
utilityKilt.line: The brown-haired one with glasses who's crocheting a spiral carpet out of recycled wool?

utilityKilt.speaker: artemis
utilityKilt.line: Yeah. Sounds like someone really doesn't like utility kilts.

roommates.speaker: artemis
roommates.line: Oh, you mean Bob and Doug? Yeah. Former roommates, too.

roommates.speaker: artemis
roommates.line: Great guys to live with, but I swear, they must have gone through a new family-sized bottle of conditioner every week.

roommates.speaker: zeff
roommates.line: Ask if Artemis lives with anyone now

roommates-live.speaker: zeff
roommates-live.line: Do you live with anyone now?

roommates-live.speaker: artemis
roommates-live.line: Nah, I've got this cute little studio all to myself. It was quite a steal, too.

roommates-live.speaker: artemis
roommates-live.line: An artist I knew from a local meetup group was moving to Berlin and needed someone to take over her lease, so I snapped it up as soon as I got a chance.

roommates-live.speaker: zeff
roommates-live.line: And I take it you like living alone?

roommates-live.speaker: artemis
roommates-live.line: I love it. Way more space to hear myself think. Though I've also got my cat, so I'm not completely alone, at least.

roommates-live.speaker: zeff
roommates-live.line: Say you're more of a dog person

roommates-cat.speaker: artemis
roommates-cat.line: Yeah. His name's Chairman Mao. He's the cutest little guy ever. I call him my boyfriend sometimes, but I'm only half joking.

roommates-cat.speaker: zeff
roommates-cat.line: Express amusement at Artemis's cat's name

roommates-cat.speaker: zeff
roommates-cat.line: Express bewilderment at Artemis's cat's name

roommates-cat.speaker: zeff
roommates-cat.line: Mention that you're allergic to cats

roommates-cat.speaker: zeff
roommates-cat.line: Say you're more of a dog person

roommates-lol.speaker: zeff
roommates-lol.line: Wait, you named your cat Chairman Mao? That's hilarious.

roommates-lol.speaker: artemis
roommates-lol.line: Heh, I'm glad someone else appreciates my silly play on words.

roommates-lol.speaker: zeff
roommates-lol.line: Say you're more of a dog person

roommates-what.speaker: zeff
roommates-what.line: Wait, you named your cat Chairman Mao? That's... well, communist dictators wouldn't be my choice of pet name, that's for sure.

roommates-what.speaker: artemis
roommates-what.line: It's... well, I'm obviously being tongue-in-cheek. Cats kind of are dictator-like, after all.

roommates-what.speaker: artemis
roommates-what.line: Of course, they get away with it by being so incredibly cute, which sadly, the real Chairman Mao wasn't.

roommates-what.speaker: zeff
roommates-what.line: Say you're more of a dog person

roommates-allergic.speaker: zeff
roommates-allergic.line: Well, that's unfortunate, because I happen to be really allergic to cats.

roommates-allergic.speaker: zeff
roommates-allergic.line: Say you're more of a dog person

roommates-dog.speaker: zeff
roommates-dog.line: I'm more of a dog person, I think. They're friendlier.

roommates-dog.speaker: artemis
roommates-dog.line: Say that dogs are also really, really needy

roommates-dog.speaker: artemis
roommates-dog.line: Ask if Zeff has a dog

roommates-needy.speaker: artemis
roommates-needy.line: Yeah, but they're also really, really needy, and I can't do needy. Cats are quite a bit lower maintenance.

roommates-sylvia.speaker: artemis
roommates-sylvia.line: Oh? Do you have a dog?

roommates-sylvia.speaker: zeff
roommates-sylvia.line: Not right now, but I had one growing up. She was a poodle named Sylvia Plath. My mom named her.

roommates-sylvia.speaker: artemis
roommates-sylvia.line: Let me guess: she was depressed and neurotic?

roommates-sylvia.speaker: zeff
roommates-sylvia.line: Actually, she was always happy and really mellow. It's funny how that worked out in the end.

magicalGirls.speaker: artemis
magicalGirls.line: Whoa... how they change into their costumes so fast?

magicalGirls.speaker: zeff
magicalGirls.line: They must have gone through a transformation sequence. It's the only logical explanation.

magicalGirls.speaker: artemis
magicalGirls.line: A transformation sequence? But I didn't hear any music or see any flashing lights.

magicalGirls.speaker: zeff
magicalGirls.line: That's because those are only for the viewers. We're just unimportant background characters in their exciting crimefighting narrative.

magicalGirls.speaker: artemis
magicalGirls.line: Well, now that you mention it, my life really does feel boring and insignificant.

magicalGirls.speaker: zeff
magicalGirls.line: I feel that way all the time.

mrDarcy.speaker: zeff
mrDarcy.line: Aww. Poor Mr. Darcy. He looks so pitiful and worked up.

mrDarcy.speaker: artemis
mrDarcy.line: Yeah, well, he's no Colin Firth, that's for sure.

mrDarcy.speaker: artemis
mrDarcy.line: Otherwise, you'd better believe I'd be over there right now asking if he's okay while taking the opportunity to stare into his brooding, dark eyes.

mrDarcy.speaker: zeff
mrDarcy.line: You know, if it really were Colin Firth, I wouldn't blame you.

makeoutKids.speaker: artemis
makeoutKids.line: Ooh, they'd better be careful, or else they might wind up in bed together smoking cigarettes or something.

makeoutKids.speaker: zeff
makeoutKids.line: You mean, like, they start making out and then literally jump cut to smoking cigarettes in bed?

makeoutKids.speaker: artemis
makeoutKids.line: That's how it works, right? I learned it from the movies, so it must be true.

makeoutKids.speaker: zeff
makeoutKids.line: Wow, I'd imagine that would get annoying pretty fast. The disorientation from the jump cuts would make me dizzy. Not to mention the cigarette smoke.

jazzStandard.speaker: artemis
jazzStandard.line: (singing) And that laugh that wrinkles your nose, touches my foolish heaaart...

jazzStandard-what.speaker: artemis
jazzStandard-what.line: Oh, a song I grew up hearing a million times and therefore can't help but sing along to at every opportunity. It's kind of an embarrassing tendency.

jazzStandard-love.speaker: artemis
jazzStandard-love.line: Yeah, I grew up hearing it a million times and therefore can't help but sing along to it at every opportunity. It's kind of an embarrassing tendency.
